steps.title: Welcome to Nexus
steps.body: This walkthrough will create a real campaign end to end. We will start in Clients, then create or select a client, create a campaign, build it, review, launch, monitor, and report.

steps.title: Open Clients
steps.body: All work begins here. Click Clients in the sidebar to view or create organizations.

steps.title: Create or select a client
steps.body: Option A: Click New Client to create Regional Food Bank. Option B: If Regional Food Bank already exists, click it to open.
steps.tip: In demo mode we seed Regional Food Bank so you can select it immediately.

steps.title: Client workspace
steps.body: You are now inside the client workspace. Each client has its own campaigns, assets, and reports.

steps.title: Create a campaign
steps.body: Click New Campaign. Use these defaults: Name End-of-Year Holiday Campaign, Goal 10000, Type End-of-Year, Dates Nov 15 to Dec 31, Theme Holiday Warmth and Community Generosity.

steps.title: Build the plan
steps.body: Add overview, upload assets, add segments Current Donors, Lapsed Donors, Volunteers, assign collaborators if needed.
steps.tip: Import your Track15 templates to prefill calendars and tags.

steps.title: Review and launch
steps.body: Confirm assets, segments, and the goal 10000. Set launch date to Nov 15. Launch when ready. Nexus begins tracking metrics automatically.

steps.title: Monitor performance
steps.body: Track total raised, donor growth, channel mix, and milestones in real time.

steps.title: Create reports
steps.body: Generate share-ready PDFs, export CSVs, or schedule weekly summaries.

steps.title: Optimize and repeat
steps.body: Duplicate top performers next year and keep iterating.
